alert.note: Alert for Converse; Goshen; Niobrara; Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 03 at 7:15PM MDT until July 03 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Niobrara County in east central Wyoming... Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... Eastern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... East central Converse County in east central Wyoming... * Until 815 PM MDT. * At 715 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles northwest of Glendo to near Two Moon Campground to near Grayrocks Reservoir to 9 miles east of Slater, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. These storms have a history of producing 60 to 70 MPH wind gusts. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Torrington, Wheatland, Lusk, Guernsey, Lingle, Fort Laramie, Glendo, Yoder, Manville, Chugcreek, Sibley Peak, Prairie Center, Keeline, Fort Laramie National Historic Site, Slater, Guernsey Campground, Rawhide Buttes, Veteran, Huntley and Two Moon Campground. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 88 and 132. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
